Fun to watch as always a raju hirani movie is always made with perfection. Not taking anything away from this movie but I think part 1 was better.

Raj Kumar Hirani really nails it with Lage Raho Munna Bhai. What a movie guys !!!! Definately a must watch movie for everyone.

10/10 from me.

"Lage Raho Munna Bhai," directed by Rajkumar Hirani, is a brilliant follow-up to the 2003 hit "Munna Bhai MBBS." Released in 2006, this film continues the story of the beloved gangster Munna Bhai, played by Sanjay Dutt, and his loyal sidekick Circuit, played by Arshad Warsi. With a perfect blend of humor, heart, and a powerful message, this film elevates the franchise to new heights.

Plot and Execution:

In this sequel, Munna Bhai, still the kind-hearted gangster, falls in love with a radio jockey, Janhavi (Vidya Balan). To win her heart, he pretends to be a history professor and a Gandhian. His life takes a turn when he starts seeing the spirit of Mahatma Gandhi (Dilip Prabhavalkar), who guides him through various challenges. Munna, inspired by Gandhi's teachings, starts a movement of "Gandhigiri" to solve everyday problems with non-violence and truth.

Strengths:

Performances:

Sanjay Dutt reprises his role as Munna Bhai with the same charm and charisma, delivering a performance that is both humorous and deeply touching. His portrayal of Munna's transformation is convincing and heartfelt.

Arshad Warsi as Circuit once again provides perfect comic relief and showcases excellent chemistry with Sanjay Dutt. Their partnership is one of the highlights of the film.

Vidya Balan as Janhavi brings warmth and sincerity to her role, making her character believable and endearing.

Dilip Prabhavalkar as Mahatma Gandhi is a standout, delivering a performance that is both respectful and impactful. His portrayal of Gandhi's spirit is a key element that drives the film's message.

Boman Irani as Lucky Singh, the antagonist, is both menacing and comical, adding depth to the conflict in the story.

Direction and Script:

Rajkumar Hirani's direction is once again masterful. He balances humor, drama, and social commentary with finesse, creating a film that is both entertaining and thought-provoking.

The screenplay, co-written by Hirani and Abhijat Joshi, is sharp, witty, and poignant. The dialogues are memorable and impactful, contributing to the film's lasting appeal.

Cinematography and Editing:

C. K. Muraleedharan's cinematography captures the vibrant essence of Mumbai and the different locales with a keen eye, enhancing the narrative visually.

The editing by Ranjeet Bahadur and Rajkumar Hirani is crisp, ensuring a smooth narrative flow that keeps the audience engaged throughout.

Music and Sound:

The soundtrack by Shantanu Moitra is delightful, featuring songs like "Pal Pal Har Pal" and "Samjho Ho Hi Gaya," which complement the film's tone and mood perfectly.

The background score enhances the emotional and comedic beats of the film, adding to its overall impact.

Themes and Social Commentary:

The film's core message of non-violence, truth, and the relevance of Gandhi's teachings in contemporary society is beautifully conveyed. The concept of "Gandhigiri" is both inspiring and practical, encouraging viewers to consider peaceful and honest solutions to conflicts.

Weaknesses:

Predictability:

Like its predecessor, the plot follows a somewhat predictable trajectory. However, the unique characters and engaging execution keep it fresh and entertaining.

Supporting Characters:

While the main characters are well-developed, some supporting characters could have been given more depth to enhance the overall narrative.

Conclusion:

"Lage Raho Munna Bhai" is a gem of a film that successfully combines humor, heart, and a powerful social message. Sanjay Dutt's endearing portrayal of Munna Bhai, coupled with Arshad Warsi's impeccable comic timing and Rajkumar Hirani's brilliant direction, make this film a must-watch. Its engaging storyline, memorable dialogues, and impactful themes ensure that it resonates with audiences of all ages.

This film not only entertains but also inspires viewers to embrace the principles of non-violence, truth, and kindness in their lives. "Lage Raho Munna Bhai" stands as a testament to the enduring relevance of Mahatma Gandhi's teachings and remains a timeless classic in Indian cinema.

review_title: LAGE RAHO MUNNABHAI is mindblowingly entertaining!!
review_detailed_main:
LAGE RAHO MUNNABHAI is mindblowingly entertaining!! (no spoilers)

The expectations from Lage Raho Munnabhai were huge. So does the movie live up to expectations? Well in terms of quality the movie is a winner from the very first scene to the very last! In short LRM is mindblowingly entertaining and it retains the feel-good element that was seen in the Munnabhai M.B.B.S. I don't think I've had this much fun watching a Bollywood film in a Long time!! The biggest plus point of the movie is its original and interesting script by VVC and Raju Hirani. It shows in the movie how hard they have work and how time they have spent in writing the script! Hats off to Raju Hirani (especially) and VVC..

The story of the movie is simple but honest treatment by Raju Hirani makes the movie work. The screenplay is simply brilliant and the movie moves forward at a breakneck pace keep the viewer engrossed in the story with plenty of non-stop laughs as well as few tears right through thats how entertaining the film is. It never drags!! Therefore IMO the real hero of the film is Rajkumar Hirani! The songs are average (though i liked them from the very first listen) but they have been picturized mindblowingly (esp. Samjho Ho hi gaya) and not for once do they hold the narrative except Pal Pal..which is nice song but wasn't required.

The Performances are yet again of high caliber! Vidya Balan is natural and looks gorgeous throughout the film.

Boman Irani as Lucky Singh is terrific yet again though his role is not as good as Dr. Asthana of Munnabhai M.B.B.S but he slips easily into his Punjabi character and is a treat to watch! The two pillars of Munnabhai series are Munna and Circuit and will always remain so! Arshad Warsi has acted so fabulously that he quite outdoes his turn in Munnabhai M.B.B.S. He was good in the original but here he is unmatchable! He is simply mind-blowing. One cannot imagine Munnabhai without Circuit! Which brings us to our Munnabhai bole to apna Sanju Baba. One might say that he looks too old in the film, that Jhanvi looks young enough to be his daughter, that he has put on weight. IMO one would be right about all of these things, and yet none of it seems to matter, so lovable is Dutt in this film. He is so endearing that we smile without a reason the moment we see him. It is difficult to even imagine another actor playing Munna, as Munna fits Dutt to the T (I'll say same for Circuit). What a charming performance!

On the finishing note i would like to say that the Chemistry between Sanjay and Arshad is electrifying. It makes my heart melt (spoiler: witness the apology scene)!! They have officially become one of my most favorite(if not the most) bollywood jodis.

I am still undecided as to which part is better..i guess i'll leave it upon my second viewing to decide! As for this year my first viewing is enough for me to say that LRM is the best movie of the year (followed closely by Zinda, RDB & Omkara) and most certainly my most favorite movie of the year!

9/10 Bring on the 3rd in the series!!

review_title: Gandhian thoughts in the circuitry of tangled brains.

review_detailed_main: UNLIKE most Hindi movies whose sequels used to flop frequently i think only this year that the sequels became hit but the sequels which where made either lacked pace or good story and screen play unlike there first parts but this movie has exceeded all expectations of mine as i thought that the movie would not be that much entertaining as the first one but i was totally proved wrong a word of appreciation should be given to the director for his work, the movie was not only a clean comedy movie but also carried message with the comedy this one entertains you from the beginning to the end the concept of MAHATMA GANDHI was great as earlier movies of him didn't make it to many hearts of the people but this movie keeping GHANDHIJI as a supporter of the lead character who is a goon by nature transfers himself to the principles followed by GHANDHIJI and tries to implement the principles of non-violence etc, which makes his life difficult for him and off-course the lead character SANJAY DUTT and his friend ARSHAD WARSI both their duo combination of comedy is just excellent all in all this movie has a very good story with equally good direction and acting.

review_title: Could almost have been made in Hollywood
review_detailed_main:
That is what I thought when watching this film. I have never watched a Bollywood film before but judging on the shorts snippets I have seen of such films, in TV-programs etc, this must be a far way from the ordinary Bollywood film. Actually I am convinced that a similar plot could easy become a successful Hollywood film. All the elements are there. There is the unhappy crook who falls in love, and to get his girl he has to pretend he is something he is not. There is the crook's comical and not to bright side-kick who supports him through thick and thin. There is the pretty and intelligent girl. And there is the ancient wisdom, here manifested in the holy Mahatma.

And then there is the typical life-changing plot. The crook tries to become a better man and at the same time succeeds in making the world a better place.

Yes I really liked it. There were a couple of musical numbers that I thought were well made and made sense. And the acting, writing and directing were all professional. Several times I laughed out loud at the comical points.

review_title: An Absolute Masterpiece: A Cinematic Triumph
review_detailed_main:
I had the pleasure of watching this movie and I must say, it is an absolute masterpiece. From the very beginning, the film captivated me with its stunning visuals and compelling storyline. The director's vision is clear and executed flawlessly, bringing a unique and refreshing perspective to the genre.

The performances are outstanding, with each actor delivering a powerful and convincing portrayal of their character. The chemistry between the leads is palpable, adding depth and authenticity to their interactions. Special mention goes to Sanjay dutt, whose performance is nothing short of extraordinary.

The cinematography is breathtaking, with each scene meticulously crafted to create a visually stunning experience. The use of color, lighting, and camera angles is masterful, enhancing the emotional impact of the story.

The soundtrack is equally impressive, perfectly complementing the mood and tone of the film. Each piece of music is thoughtfully chosen and adds an extra layer of emotion to the narrative.

Lage Raho Munna Bhai is the last film I ever saw on DVD. And I'm really glad that the final film I saw on that platform turned out to be so great. Everything about this film is absolutely perfect, and that's actually saying something since this is only the second film by Rajkumar Hirani (the first being its prequel). It's really surprising that Hirani created such an iconic duo in his very first duology films.

The film is set around Munna Bhai once again, as he tries to impress an RJ after winning a competition about Mahatma Gandhi. It is really funny that Murali, someone who is literally the opposite of Gandhi, resolves to give up on the thing that ensures his survival in the otherwise violent world. Before I saw this film I didn't even know that there are actually people who don't like Mahatma Gandhi, since I was just 7 years old and didn't know anything about politics. As I grew up, I understood the role of Gandhi more and more, and how different political ideologies tend to see him. And Lucky was a good example of this.

Lucky tends to be Munna's biggest problem in this film. He is exactly the opposite of what Munna wants himself to be. As one goon is on his path to redemption, the other wants to drag on in the destructive life that he lives. In the world where people tend to use any means to justify their ends, odds are mostly in Lucky's favour. This shows why and how Mahatma Gandhi must have also faced problems in his times. There are occasional stories on Gandhi, telling how he took his decisions and what challenges he had to face, comparing their similarities and differences with Munna.

My favourite character in this film was Circuit as usual. He always has the air of being a character who can never want something wrong to happen with Munna and takes any path he needs in order to satisfy his boss. He does make his mistakes and tries a little too hard to appease Munna, but in reality is a person pure of heart and a loyal sidekick. My favourite scene was when Munna becomes an RJ himself and gives tips to his audience by taking help from Mahatma Gandhi's hallucinations. And finally in the end he is able to use these methods to convince Lucky.

I really wanted there to be more such films, but now Sanjay Dutt and Arshad Warsi have both aged very much so there's no way we are ever getting this back. Also some things are better off left in nostalgia rather than being dragged on and getting ruined. This film is great to occasionally come back to. If anyone wants to watch Bollywood comedies, this duology is the perfect place to start from.

forget about the slapstick, this film is a timely and extremely successful peek at the horrors of Indian society today - corruption, superstition, lack of truthfulness, meaningless idolatry...munnabhai will make a difference, you can just see it by the audience response.

a social satire draped around the slapslickness of the basic premise, this is the best thing to a black comedy that has come via bollywood since "jaane bhi do yaaro".

well done munna and circuit..and lage raho hamare fellow citizens...forget about crying about the national song, remember your basic civic duties.

To deliver such a movie in present times with such a powerful message is truly commendable. The movies starts of on a slightly trite note but later flowers into a movie with high impact. The best part about the movie is that it is presented in a way that most common people can relate to it.. It is this quality that has propelled the movie to such acclaim. This is the sort of movie that showcases the true spirit of India and its father, Mahatma Gandhi.

In times when its considered sissy to not have an "eye for an eye" this movie breaks all trends and goes back to good old days.

its hard to describe the sort of reactions its produced in India for real. May it suffice for me to say that a lot of incidents or rather the methods used to achieve the goal in a larger sense, have actually started bearing fruit.

Kudos to the director for making such a movie in present times. Though the movie has done exceeding well, it also ran the serious risk of bombing at the box office. By opening himself to possible criticism and still sticking to his guts, the director has done justice to the movie as well as its message. God bless.

To be very honest I was not very sure if they could match the class of Munnabhai MBBS again. Even though I watched the film a good three weeks after the release, by that time the rave reviews and ripple on the box office were sign enough to make anyone believe that they have done it again. But not me. I was of the opinion that this one would have a big hangover of MBBS and people are liking what they liked in earlier version, and there would not be anything new to offer.

BUT.... how wrong perceptions can be.

This is a revelation of sorts. Its not even a single notch below the its predecessor. Its right up there.... on the top, among the finest films of the year...or if I may dare to say EVER. Just when we were actually forgetting Mahatma Gandhi, and he starting to become nothing more than a photo on currency notes, comes Lage Raho Munnabhai... rejuvenating Mahatma from nowhere. Franckly speaking, I was not a fan of Mahatma Gandhi, I am not very impressed with his doings... but this film surely changed the perception a lot if not completely.

Revealing or commenting anything on the story or performance or any other technical aspect of the film would be stupidity, as its seen to be believed.

You'll realize the beauty of the film when you won't realize when your eyes were filled with tears while laughing your hearts out.

Lage Raho Munnabhai, Raju Harani (Director), VV Chopra (Producer) and the entire team.

Don't MISS THIS ONE.

Easily the most loved "dynamic duo" in today's cinema world, Munna Bhai and his sidekick, Circuit are back! And this time, they come together in the sequel of the fame hit to Munna Bhai MBBS is Lage Raho Munna Bhai.

It's a normal day for this happy go lucky duo. The love interest this time is Vidya Balan as a Radio Jockey. The radio jockey idea seems obvious with the hit of Priety Zinta as the RJ in Salaam Namaste, and also keeping in touch with the recent trend of radio coming into vogue again, this time with a bang.

The basic idea behind Munna Bhai is the same, mistaken identity and doing crazy things to keep the girl interested in him this time, however, Munna does not go to college as a student (thank god). Jahnvi (Vidya Balan) mistakes Munna for a history professor! The Movie carries on where it left, lots of fun, extremely witty and not to forget  humor with a message - with Jahnvi testing Munna's "historical interests".

This is not just another movie in the park - I don't want to spoil the surprise, but, here is a spoiler: Gandhi playing a "role" in the movie, there are some interesting moments.

With a twist in the run of events, the movie proves how contemporary the Gandhian values are.

The Songs are not what you might call chart busters, with Kabhi Alvida na Kehna topping every music channel in sight, but songs are a luxury anyway in this wonderful movie.

Investing money in watching this movie will pay you rich dividends  laughter, fun and extreme satisfaction! There are apprehensions over the prices of cinema tickets, but this movie makes you sigh and gives you value for money From student to teacher, Munna has most definitely graduated and come of age! Arshard Warsi is too good once again They say sequels are not so successful as the first movie, but this movie shall be the path breaking movie breaking that theory! Lage Raho indeed! Aptly named!

In this romantic comedy, a talented yet socially awkward doctor finds herself navigating the complexities of love while tending to her patients. She is joined by a charming and laid-back pediatrician, and together they form an unlikely bond while working on a high-profile medical case involving conjoined twins. The film expertly weaves humor into the story, providing plenty of laugh-out-loud moments without detracting from its genuine emotional core. The chemistry between the two leads crackles with wit and charm, making their budding romance both believable and heartwarming. As their relationship deepens, audiences are kept on the edge of their seats by a healthy dose of drama. Overall, this romantic comedy is a delightful blend of humor, romance, and heartfelt moments that will leave viewers smiling long after the credits roll.

review_title: Best Hindi comedy in a long time
review_detailed_main:
Really good Hindi comedies are few and far between. Lage Raho Munna Bhai is by far one of the best in recent times. You will laugh till your sides ache, and you will be forced to think about truth and non-violence on your way back to reality. The movie starts with a music that will tell you it is a sequel to Munna Bhai MBBS, but goes off as an independent story, with only the main characters (Munna Bhai, Circuit and the other "dhobis") coming back. Boman Irani is in this "sequal", but in a totally different role, to which he does justice AND MORE.

The story is woven well, the music is hummable and meaningful (something which Hindi films lack a lot), the choreography is pleasing, the directing is wonderful and the acting is superb. Boman Irani (Lucky Singh) and Arshad Varsi (Circuit) steal the show, and Sanjay Dutt (Munna) and Vidya Balan (Janvi) are not far behind.

Even when the plot gets a little "serious", the film holds the audience (this is what Hindi films mostly mess up).

After you have watched it once and laughed a lot, watch it again: there will be bits and pieces of comedy and thought-provoking dialogue and actions to notice the second time, which will make sense.

This is a movie to treasure. I hope more movies like this hit the screens.

I thought this movie was excellent! It literally brought tears of joy to my eyes. I recommend this movie to anyone. It really doesn't matter if you have seen the first movie or not. Even though this is a sequel, it doesn't have a continuing storyline. But that doesn't matter at all. The plot in this movie is awesome. The story, the best I have seen in a Hindi movie. But if you don't want to see the movie, don't. No one is forcing you. My favorite part was the Munna/Circuit apology. It was so deep and emotional. I can't tell you how much I loved this movie because I will keep repeating myself and that is kind of what I am doing so I can take up these minimum of 10 lines that i need. But seriously though, watch the movie. It will be worth your time.
Good movie with some good content. Sanju rocks in this film. One of the best sequel made in Bollywood.

review_title: Gandhigiri is the future of India
review_detailed_main:
It is the greatest Movie of the century. It is the height of Man's intelligence of story telling.If Movie "Gandhi" got so many Oscars, this movie "Lage Raho Munnabhai" deserves 10 times more Oscars.

Gandhism is very intelligently communicated to the mass through " Gandhigiri".

There is an element of psychology in the movie. But, that is how this whole universe works on principles of belief.We should take this as an intelligent way of the director, to communicate with the viewers.

"Gandhigiri" is the only future for India, through which it can win the world, not by high tech software, or high rise buildings. This is the only principle, which will cleanse India of all corruption and cheap politics.

Vittal Belandor, Bangalore

review_title: Bollywood's finest product in recent memory
review_detailed_main:
Anyone familiar with Bollywood can be forgiven for reading the title of this review and not being particularly impressed - Bollywood has produced some profoundly horrible films in awe-inspiring quantities in the past.

But Lage Raho Munnabhai sets aside all of the usual complaints one has about Bollywood. Its plot is in no way ripped off of something from Hollywood - indeed, it would be hard to come up with something more uniquely Indian. The songs, while ridiculous in a way that only Bollywood can achieve, are not so far gone as to be irredeemable and are actually well integrated into the plot. Finally, while the central motivating force for the plot is a typical Bollywood impossible love, the actual theme of the film is far deeper. True, the movie carries about it a certain absurd quality in everything from dialog to editing, such does nothing to detract from the power of the message.

The plot, in short: Mumbai mobster Munna falls in love with a radio jockey, but to impress her pretends to be a professor who specializes in Mahatma Gandhi. In the process, he is forced to learn Gandhi's philosophy, causing a "chemical imbalance" in the form of Mahatma Gandhi's ghost who compels him to solve his problems with peace and truth.

Though the main factor of this movie is comedy, at which it succeeds quite well (Circuit is far better characterized and thus far more lovable than in Munnabhai, M.B.B.S.), what I took away was a shaking awe of this man we call Mahatma. Though its exposition of his philosophy is a bit more modern/ridiculous than what the Mahatma practiced, it nonetheless accurately conveys the sheer courage of satyagraha. A mobster, someone accustomed to killing and being killed, is forced to acknowledge that real courage comes in taking a blow rather than fighting back. The movie's implication is that our modern society believes only the insane would follow in the path of Gandhi, yet watching it makes one wish more of our leaders today had "chemical imbalances."

One of the most loved movies of our time, Munnabhai MBBS has the kind of repeat viewing value that few other movies can boast of. It's not surprising then, that when Rajkumar Hirani wanted to make a sequel and took a survey all over the country for an apt title, a majority said 'Lage Raho Munnabhai'! So he dropped his title 'Munnabhai Meets Mahatma Gandhi' and settled for the public vote instead. This movie had expectations rocketing to the moon, but one is highly surprised to see that this movie is as good as the first one-it's not really a sequel, it just has Munna and his adorable sidekick Circuit and a host of other characters, some seen in the original like Boman Irani and Jimmy Shergill, playing completely different roles, and some new and brilliant finds. The safest thing for Hirani is that there can be no comparison with MBBS, as it has got nothing to do with it, but is fresh, new, hilarious, thought-provoking and has two of the most memorable characters in Indian film history-Munnabhai, Circuit, and their inimitable slang.

what can you say about this movie, i have seen it so many times now and i still luv this as much as i did the first time. You become so involved with the movie it makes you think you're actually with them. The comedy is just as promising as its pre-quel.

Moving on to the cast well Munna bhai isn't complete without Sanjay Dutt, and where would he be without Arshad Warsi aka Circuit, the comedy pairing is so perfect. this is the second movie i have seen with Vidya Balan casted and i have to say she is just as perfect in the role of Janvi, minus the "good morning mumbai" which became fairly annoying.

This is definitely a movie to watch u will be laughing through out as well as understanding the message the movie portrayed.

I wont go into the details but its worth a watch. So please if u get the chance I'm sure you'll love it.

Finally we have a sequel better than it's original. Truly, I was driven into deep thought as I watched Lage Raho Munnabhai. What makes the movie so touchy is Mahatma Gandhi, and it's the reason why today's youngsters must watch this film. This is a film about truth, honesty and selflessness and behind a light-hearted comic screenplay lays deep thoughts and realities of today's society. Munnabhai meets Gandhi, and his world changes, but more than that it compels us to think what if we meet Gandhi and feel embarrassed upon ourselves for not being able to take what he wanted us to.

I am not an Indian, but Gandhi being an Indian has laid down a path of truth and honesty for people all around the world. To say the least, Gandhi is the God of modern times and people like him aren't born often. The producers of this film have attempted to unravel the reality of our times where people have become so mean and selfish, that in fact if today Gandhi was to come back, would sadly return embarrassed and humiliated seeing how badly we all have failed to give him respect and cared less to what he said and did.

And if films like these continue to come up, we may one day say that Gandhi isn't gone.

review_title: Sanjay Dutt aka Munnnabhai deserve award for this!
review_detailed_main:
Munnabhai Returns!!

Well i watched the film good expectations but the film surpassed my expectations. Frm the Director to the actor everyone simply rocked! The story was really

good.. The concept was fresh and original! There is not a single boring moment in the film! Sanjay Dutt fits Munnabhai to the T and am not even a big fan of his. No one can play this role better then him.. He was out of the world just like in Munnabhai MBBS..He was excellent in every scene..bet it emotional or comic!. bole to award daina mangta hai mamuuu!! Arshad Warsi as circuit was good but OTT sometime.. ! Boman was very good..his best performance after MBBS! Vidya Balan was beautiful...

Munnabhai/Circuit scenes were hilarious and Munnabhai/Lucky Singh scenes were great too.. Sanjay was just awesome in all scenes!! This is one heck of pasia vasool film.. The best one this year!!

This film is not just hilarious but gives you a message too.. Ghandgiri as Sanjay says in his tapori style is going to be really popular.. I brought in my friend to the cinema.. He is doesn't like Bollywood movie but he loved this one!!!

Well folks nothing much to say except go and watch it because you have to watch it to believe it!

10/10

This has got to be one of the most inspiring films made in the Indian Film Industry in the last decade. The other films I can think of are 'MunnaBhai MBBS', 'Hydrabad Blues' and 'Nayak'. Though HB was an independent effort. The script of LRMB is too good. When Boman Irani says "Get Well Soon Munna" it struck me so hard. The whole plot is in loops. Taxi driver and running bride already have a connection from the previous scenes. The script may not be air-tight but its definitely very well edited and has imaginative loops. Although the backdrop of the film is love story it actually is a social drama. Beautiful!!! The concept that Gandhiji only answers questions Munna already knew was just too much. That shows how tight and well thought out the plot actually is which looks like a regular comedy.

Boman Irani is very good. Sanjay Dutt is convincing. Vidya Balan is just cute smiles. She was much better in 'Hum Panch'. Kulbhushan Kharbanda is great as usual. Arshad Warsi walked away with the glory this time. No doubt. He got the best lines and every time he got the home run. Dilip Prabhavalkar was also very convincing considering the kind of job he had to do. Theatre and films are two different medium. I will definitely see him on stage now. Diya Mirza has improved. Jimmy Shergil was also very impressive. It was nice to see Parikshat Sahni after so long. Although casting says three names in the writing department but we know for a fact that the brain behind this fantastic film is Rajkumar Hirani. Great Job. Must have been a journey for a sound editor in 'Hero Hiralal' to direct a film after 15 years and that too 'Munnabhai MBBS'.

There are so many fantastic scenes in this film but my favorite is when lawyers beat up Gujju lawyer Dhansukh Bhai Patel. It's a very positive effort with many social messages. The most important things about the film are that it is very modern, talks about real issues with humor and is not preachy. 9/10

review_title: Munna Bhai .... Excellent movie!! Lage Raho.. Even Better
review_detailed_main:
I saw this movie last week (Sunday). I wanted to see it at Priya Cineplex which is the best movie theater in Delhi (arguably), but realized that the movie was not at any PVR multiplexes (due to some settlement issues).

Nevertheless, I had to see the movie as I was very sure that the movie would be a total failure as the first part (MBBS) was very good. I just wanted to see how bad ... so much so that I got a Rs. 70 ($1.25) ticket at Rs. 150 ($3.0) at one of those Other Cinema halls.

In retrospect now, I have found the movie to be definitely worth the last penny that I spent. Lage Raho is BETTER than MBBS (IMDB rating are already specking the story!!!). Although, I am not one of those techy movie goers, but I know for sure that the Critics would have a VERY difficult time critique'ing this one. The best part of the movie is that the director did not go the conventional route of connecting the threads with the prequel and then loosing the focus from the story. I have seen many Bollywood (sequel) movies not doing well because the directors were not ready to experiment  Kriss is a classic example of a sequel movie gone WRONG!!

On specifics: Sanjay Dutt is looking old .but who cares!! He is still going strong. Arshad Warsi .. who knows him by his original name now? :-) At least my parents don't . He is "Circuit" for them. Vidya Balan . She is not there just for her chocolaty presence. She delivers!!! Boman Irani . One talented SOB!! 2nd Innings Team .. perfect. (especially the "Kissing Car")

Rest of the team is equally good.

And Finally: The Mahatma .. Needless to say, the director has treaded an extremely difficult path of featuring a popular political/human figure in the most subtle of manner. Normally, movies of such type end up raising many eyebrows (if not only from the censor board). Not this one!

Bravo to the whole crew!! . This movie will go into Bollywood folklore as being one of those better known classic movies.

Today, I got to know that PVR is also featuring this movie and I will not miss the opportunity of watching the movie again at my favorite Cineplex  Priya!!!

Please watch it once!!

PS: This is my first review on any movie till date. I just couldn't resist the temptation to comment on this PERFECT movie. 10/10 :-)

The most awesome film i have seen for a long long time.the way raju hirani has carried his story is unbelievable.if you thought m.b.b.s was awesome,wait till you see this film.the trailers didn't do justice to the film's content.i would have never believed it could be this good,until i saw it.its hard to imagine what the film holds in the second half,but i bet it is better than most of us could imagine.the way this film has inspired us Indians has to be seen to be believed.its impact can be seen in our politics as well.sanjay dutt has got what he needed to be remembered as one of the all time greats. all hail Munnabhai.

review_title: Sequels are foreign to Indian movies but this one...
review_detailed_main:
...is a trend setter. I wont review the storyline since many have done a better job.

Making a comedy, yet a contemporary message oriented, movie has not only been a challenge to Indian movie makers but also been a disaster. Such movies were always the strongholds of trained movie makers or new art film directors from Film Institue in Pune.

The movie is strictly not a sequel in the sense that the storyline is completely new. However, the Munna-Circuit duo is kept very much intact and the punchy dialogues distributed evenly among all characters. This time Munna meets Mahatma Gandhi and makes a disastrous yet a hilarious attempt to reform himself (and an others!). What starts of as an innocent visit to Gandhi library to impress his heartthrob ( a radio show host) spirals into a Gandhian struggle to reclaim the land of a small old age home. How Munna manages to come through this is the whole story.

Of course, Munna is incomplete without Circuit who combines the devotion of Lakshman (to Ram) and naiveté of Sancho Panza (of Don Quixote). Their pair is likely to be exploited commercially in the time to come. At times the movie risks the glorification of 'Goondagiri' but manages to steer clear of it with the help of Gandhigiri. The satire that drips through every line of the story nails home the point of Gandhi's relevance in modern times. However his main strength of 'Satyagraha' is never emphasized as much as the spirit of forgiveness (which is amply demonstrated).

This is a MUST-WATCH movie even for the movie audiences in the United States and the Hollywood Industry. In fact the sequel is worth a remake in Hollywood than its prequel that has 'patches' of "Patch Adams".

Laugh your way through this film and for sure it starts a chemical locha in ur dimag. This could well be the dawn of a new age bollywood film making, the script is crisp so is the direction. A must watch for its realistic approach to the modern day issues but with a Gandhian Flavour aka Gandhigiri. If bollywood has to get recognition at the global level, it should try churning out movies of this calibre, which not only showcases Indian Values of truth and ahimsa, but also the need of the modern age to embrace them. Hats off to Vidhu Vinod Chopra and Rajkumar Hirani, for giving back Bapu to India. Excellence is stamped all over the film as it smoothly sails from one frame to another. It leaves us with a thought to reconsider and rediscover the ideals of Father Of India, Mahatma Gandhi. The Ideals are as relevant today as then.

review_title: Gangster & Gandhi prove it. Truth alone triumphs!

review_detailed_main:
Excellent story line...truly original theme. Couldn't stop laughing.. Circuit's character is very lovable & Lucky Singh has spoken like a true Punjabi....Would highly recommend this for one and all, young or old.

The Bambaiya Hindi brought back a lot of memories on our previous life in Mumbai.... All the characters have been cast very well & the songs are pretty good too. Vidya Balan & Sanjay Dutt shine in their roles & all the supporting cast do a great job too.

A film which preaches good moral values in a hilarious way... I personally think this takes the 1st Munnabhai movie to a higher level.

review_title: Better than the first in some ways
review_detailed_main: Love and being good always triumphs, although these values don't always work in the real world they work beautifully in Lage Raho Munna Bhai. Chemistry between the leads is great, Sanjay Dutt, Vidya Balan, Asrad Warsi, and Boman Irani knock it out or the park and the lesson to be a good person and triumph is endearingly told. Songs are better than the first movie IMHO. Worth the watch

review_title: Generations to come will scarce believe that such a one as this walked the earth in flesh and blood
review_detailed_main: I don't watch too many Indian movies these days because i am putout by the rubbish they come out with.But lage raho munnabhai was a welcome change. I had seen the first movie (munnabhai MBBS) and i had liked it. Although the first movie had borrowed its theme from patch Adams,nonetheless the director did a good job. The second movie was totally original(to my knowledge).It shows how a small time goon by chance is forced to learn about Gandhi by chance,and he starts realizing his mistakes.He tries to go out and tells the world the forgotten message of Gandhi. In short he tries to prove wrong the prophesy of Albert Einsteins "Generations to come will scarce believe that such a one as this walked the earth in flesh and blood". This movie passes along many social messages without being too corny.

Lage raho munnabhai.....what to say about this movie.I think this is the most positive & optimistic movie ever made in Indian cinema.Its not a movie showing life of Gandhi and his principles but tells you how these principles can be practically implemented to solve some very common problems like corruption.......using gandhigiri.

This movie is a good blend of comedy,emotions and of course gandhigiri.Everybody has done good acting especially Arshad Warsi.I am sure after watching you will never forget this movie.If faced by situations shown in the movie,in real life, you will always be guided by their solutions as shown.

So do not just watch this movie for entertainment but also try to take the message it gives.............

enough has been said already about how good or the thoughtful the movie is, so wont repeat that here.

The only disappointment was the title itself. The name gave me the impression of some real commercial, laugh-n-forget a typical Hindi movie and came out wondering what a great innovative plot to make a movie on. solid thoughtful storyline and yet very comical !!

a very clever job by the director/writer to convey Gandhiji message in a simplest possible way.

Arshad Warsi is hilarious. Sanjay dutt looks old at times.

director could do a better job in portraying these 2 as don, esp in Mumbai real estate market.

review_title: Truly original Hindi comedy after a long while?
review_detailed_main: As someone who yearns for light-hearted quality Hindi cinema of the 70's from the likes of Hrishikesh Mukherjee, Basu Chatterjee and others, I am sure that I am not alone in having been disenchanted with Bollywood for quite some time for what seemed like a lack of creativity and blatant imitation of Hollywood under the excuse of "inspiration". I am happy to report that Lage Raho Munnabhai will turn people like me into believers again. This is an indigenous, intelligent effort driven by some great out of the box creative thinking by the film-makers. Congratulations to the film-makers and we should certainly hope that we'll get to see more of such intelligent, original, world-class cinema from the world's largest film industry!

review_title: Best comedy movie I have ever seen.
review_detailed_main:
It's a perfect bled of all important ingredients of a fabulous movie.

If you don't rate this movie 9 + the some wrong with your sense of humor! Any age group it's a must watch.

It's also got a great message, which has faded in time. It makes you think yet does not stress you. Depicts some important aspects in life in a jovial way. Sunjay Dutt and Arshad Warasi have done a great job again proving the 2nd squeal can be better than the first one. The humor is great and it appears natural on screen unlike other comedy movies where in comedy is drilled in.

Thanks to Vidhu Vinod Chopra and Rajkumar Hirani for making a film that is more than just a rip-roaring comedy. It makes you laugh, makes you cry and make you think .

I have seen so many comedy movies , where comedy is forced and the Actors have to make all kinds of funny faces and tricks. But this movie just takes you through the real streets of Mumbai its almost like an Art Film . Especially Ghandigiri portrayed is something where the script writer doesn't want to preach yet he delivers the message in a very straight forward manner . All the things happening around us i know in real life for us to ensure total Ghandigiri is impossible in the present world but not to forget, thats the way we got our freedom from the British. This is the best performance by Mr. Sanjay Dutt , an ignorant strong man and then there goes ( I will call him a phenomenon ) Arshad Warsi , a friend who is more than a friend , his acting is something which makes you forget all your troubles. I was even laughing while i was walking out of the cinema. This is definitely a hilarious movie ever made in the history of Indian Cinema , where all age groups could watch together. Hats off to the entire crew

One of the best Hindi movies ever seen after a long time. I like this movie better than some of the best Hollywood movies. The Gandhi factor is so beautifully woven into the script. No hard preachings, but still manages to communicate the message very strongly.. This should be given tax free in all Indian states as it has a very strong message to convey. This will remain one of the best movies that has been churned out by Bolloywood for many years to come .. Songs are melodious, comedy is hilarious (makes you really laugh out loud), emotions touches you so much (you virtually cry.!) and acting and direction is top-class ..! Hail MUNNA, CIRCUIT and GANDHIJI trio...!!

After a long time I have seen a movie that is entertaining as well has some good values. Most Hindi flicks play to the masses - so does this one. But the biggest difference is that it carries a powerful message. The best part is that I was not bored for a single moment in this movie. The songs are pretty good and the director has done a great job of editing the movie.

Actingwise, Sanjay Dutt and Boman Irani are good, but the best part is played by Arshad Warsi. His dialogue delivery and facial expressions are a treat to watch. Even a stupid joke appears funny when Arshad Warsi delivers it. All in all, kudos to the movie team. Great job guys and I hope more Hindi film makers take to making movies that are fun and carry a message instead of the same love stories.

Riding high on expectations due to its well-accepted predecessor (Munnabhai MBBS), this movie satiated every 'tapori' who cared to invest his time to watch this classy 'lafra'. Munnabhai, the goon with a golden heart, returns to the silver screen with his second-in-command Circuit. This time, he takes on something he is not accustomed to: non-violence. In order to win over his love, lovely Jhanvi, Munna introduces himself to the ideologies of Mahatma Gandhi. How he endures, flourishes and spreads 'Gandhigiri' is what this movie is all about. Almost everything appears well-manicured in this movie. Well thought independent events to sprinkle Gandhism makes every moment of this movie likable. Except Jhanvi, every other character is well sketched and the movie tickles you hard with its hilarious 'tapori' lines and hard-nut Gandhism. Never preachy, Gandhism attains new heights and diffuses into the viewer quite efficiently. And finally, there is Sanjay Dutt, who after his portrayal of several hardcore gangster characters, blasts the screen with his rustic charms as Munnabhai. A must see if you want a nice laugh with some thought provoking leftovers to ponder upon as you scroll down the credit titles at the end.

review_title: Hilarious comedy with loads of substance
review_detailed_main: Very few Hindi movies can claim what this movie can and should. Clean, "above the belt" comedy and a subtle yet powerful message, that's what makes this movie so unique and worth watching. It was heartwarming to see that someone could weave a fine story using elements like tapori (goon) lingo, simple romance, day-day problems of the common-man and Gandhiji's ideology. And yet, no compromise at all. Kudos!!! Sanjay Dutt is at his best again, and Arshad Warsi is impressive with his flawless, spontaneous comedy. Almost everyone from the previous movie has a big or small ( yet significant) role here. While Vidya Balan does good justice to Jhanvi's role, Gracy Singh's absence was felt; just for the reason that she did such a great job in the Munnabhai MBBS. After "Rang De Basanti", this is another movie which portrays the restlessness in today's youth to change the rotten system prevalent in India. If only we could have more such movies in these times. Again kudos to the entire team for making this masterpiece!

review_title: The one bollywood movie which deserves an Oscar
review_detailed_main: This is not just a movie, it's an experience and no offense but you ARE a fool if you haven't seen this movie, and you are definitely not a human being if you haven't liked this movie. The three hours journey leaves you totally stunned as it makes you cry, laugh, and connect to the characters. Somewhere, in the movie, it makes you realize your wrong doings in life. You don't cry for the characters in the movie, but for yourself. I have seen this movie for like at least more than fifty times now, and still every time i see it, I learn a lot from it. Emotional is an understatement for this movie, it is much more than that. This kind of cinema has never been done and I am definitely sure can never be repeated again, not just in bollywood but anywhere in the world. The movie simply teaches you a way of life, a way for you to realize that you are not just a highly developed class of animals fighting for surviving on this planet but much more than that. Believe me, you will thank me after watching this movie if you are watching it after reading my comment, moreover you will thank yourself for watching it, you will feel deep in your heart a sense of relief and satisfaction as if you have done something great.

This was a great movie. It was funny and entertaining, yet weaved a strong and very needed message through out the movie. It was great to see a movie that was able to entertain yet remind us of history and the message we may forget. I admired how the many different threads of this movie i.e. music, comedy, and history were brought together so well. Being American and having to read the sub-titles didn't take anything away from this movie for me. I was very moved by this movie, and would recommend it for every one to see. Sanjay Dutt being so handsome is an added plus in watching this movie ..wink..

Labiba

review_title: Though made in 2006 . It's more relevant today
review_detailed_main: A brilliant movie. Must see for all and learn how the indian Psyche is tuned to gandhigiri

review_title: Much needed for every Generation!!! Greatest movie.
review_detailed_main:
Each and every dialogue has its great meaning.

Movie engages you from start to end. Eagerness increases as movie goes... Bhai circuit bhi hai na ismainnnn.....

review_title: The Gandhi in all of us !
If Mahatma Gandhi visited back, the credits are to the Munna (Bhai Lage Raho) scheme, and all your team.
